raw_text:
Robinson out of Six Nations
 
 England captain Jason Robinson will miss the rest of the Six Nations because of injury.
 
 Robinson, stand-in captain in the absence of Jonny Wilkinson, had been due to lead England in their final two games against Italy and Scotland. But the Sale full-back pulled out of the squad on Wednesday because of a torn ligament in his right thumb. The 30-year-old will undergo an operation on Friday but England have yet to name a replacement skipper.
 
 Robinson said: "This is very disappointing for me as this means I miss England's last two games in the Six Nations at Twickenham and two games for my club, Sale Sharks. "But I'm looking to be back playing very early in April."
 
 Robinson picked up the injury in the 19-13 defeat to Ireland at Lansdowne Road on Saturday. And coach Andy Robinson said: "I am hugely disappointed for Jason. "As England captain he has been an immense figure during the autumn internationals and the Six Nations, leading by example at all times. I look forward to having him back in the England squad." The announcement is the latest setback for Robinson's injury-depleted squad.
 
 Among the key figures already missing are Jonny Wilkinson, Mike Tindall, Will Greenwood, Julian White and Phil Vickery - a list which leaves Robinson short on candidates for the now vacant captaincy role. Former England skipper Jeremy Guscott told BBC Radio Five Live his choice would be Matt Dawson, even though he is does not hold a regular starting place.
 
 "The obvious choice is Dawson" said Guscott. "Especially given that Harry Ellis did not have his best game at scrum-half on Saturday. "Dawson has the credentials and the experience, even though his winning record at captain is not great. "The other option in Martin Corry, who is the standout forward at the moment. "Unfortunately England cannot rely on leaders on the field at the moment." England will announce their squad for the 12 March game against Italy on Saturday.
llama3.2:1b: Jason Robinson will miss Six Nations matches after tearing his right thumb ligament during a loss to Ireland.
He underwent surgery on Friday and is expected to miss two games with Sale Sharks.
The team has yet to name a replacement skipper, with Jeremy Guscott suggesting Matt Dawson as an option despite not playing regularly for England.
llama3.2:3b: Jason Robinson to miss rest of Six Nations due to injury, pulls out of team and undergoes operation Friday, expected return in early April, England struggling with injury-depleted squad missing several key players including Jonny Wilkinson, Mike Tindall, Will Greenwood, Julian White and Phil Vickery, former captain Jeremy Guscott suggests Matt Dawson as possible replacement captain.
gemma2:2b: England captain Jason Robinson tore a ligament in his right thumb and will miss the rest of the Six Nations, requiring surgery on Friday.
The injury occurred during the Ireland match.
Robinson's absence leaves England short on leadership options as key players like Jonny Wilkinson are also out injured.
Former captain Jeremy Guscott suggests Matt Dawson would be an ideal replacement.
England will announce their squad for the Italy game on Saturday.
qwen2.5:0.5b: England's Jonny Wilkinson and Mike Tindall are expected to be back in the starting line-up ahead of next month's Six Nations, while Jason Robinson is out because of an injury.
England has already announced they have no replacement captain yet.
qwen2.5:1.5b: England rugby player Jason Robinson, expected to lead the team through the Six Nations, will miss all remaining games due to an injury in his right thumb, with Robinson also facing a potential extended absence as he undergoes surgery next Friday.
The announcement marks another setback for England's depleted squad, which includes injured players such as Jonny Wilkinson and Mike Tindall.
Former skipper Jeremy Guscott prefers Matt Dawson but considers Martin Corry an option, noting the need to rely on field leaders given current circumstances.
The team will announce their final 23-player list for the match against Italy on March 12.
qwen2.5:3b: England captain Jason Robinson will miss the rest of the Six Nations due to a torn thumb ligament, leading to his absence in final two games against Italy and Scotland.
He underwent surgery and England has yet to name a replacement skipper.
The injury leaves Robinson short on candidates for the now vacant captaincy role.
Former England skipper Jeremy Guscott suggests Matt Dawson or Martin Corry as potential replacements.
opencoder:1.5b: Robinson out of Six Nations was a captivating journey that marked England's defeat to Ireland in the Six Nations final two games against Italy and Scotland, with injury from a torn ligament on Wednesday.
Despite the disappointment, he ventured into the heart of international football, demonstrating a passion for defending his squad against tough adversaries.
He took part in the autumn internationals during the TwickenhamGames and was named a captain after his remarkable performance.
However, he struggled to retain his position as England captain due to injuries.
The squad is currently missing several key figures, including Jonny Wilkinson, Mike Tindall, Will Greenwood, Julian White, Phil Vickery, and former England skipper Jeremy Guscott.
His choice of Matt Dawson was a pivotal moment in his life, despite the absence of his best game on Saturday.
smollm:1.7b:
Robinson out of Six Nations
England captain Jason Robinson will miss the rest of the Six Nations because of injury.
Robinson, stand-in captain in the absence of Jonny Wilkinson, had been due to lead England in their last two games against Italy and Scotland.
But the Sale full-back pulled out of the squad on Wednesday because of a torn ligament in his right thumb.
The 30-year-old will undergo an operation on Friday but England have yet to name a replacement skipper.
Robinson said: "This is very disappointing for me as this means I miss England's last two games in the Six Nations at Twickenham and two games for my club, Sale Sharks."
But he added: "I'm looking to be back playing very early in April."
Robinson picked up the injury in the 19-13 defeat to Ireland at Lansdowne Road on Saturday.
And coach Andy Robinson said: "I am hugely disappointed for Jason.
As England captain he has been an immense figure during the autumn internationals and the Six Nations, leading by example at all times."
He added: "The injury is a setback for the team as a whole but it does not necessarily mean that Jason will be out of action for the rest of the season."

Among the key figures already missing are Jonny Wilkinson, Mike Tindall, Will Greenwood, Julian White and Phil Vickery - a list which leaves Robinson short on candidates for the now vacant captaincy role.
Former England skipper Jeremy Guscott told BBC Radio Five Live his choice would be Matt Dawson, even though he is does not have his best game at scrum-half on Saturday.
"The obvious choice is Dawson" said Guscott.
"Especially given that Harry Ellis did not have his best game at scrum-half on Saturday.
"Dawson has the credentials and the experience, even though his winning record at captain is not great.
The other option in Martin Corry, who is the standout forward at the moment.
"Unfortunately England cannot rely on leaders on the field at the moment."
England will announce their squad for the 12 March game against Italy on Saturday.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Robinson is missing the Six Nations because of injury, standing in as a stand-in captain alongside Jonny Wilkinson.
He had been expected to lead England in two games but lost the stand-in game against Ireland.
The squad will play Italy next Tuesday, March 12.
tinyllama:1.1b: England captain Jason Robinson will miss the rest of the Six Nations due to a torn ligament in his right thumb.

The 30-year-old skipper withdrew from the squad on Wednesday due to an injury, which means he will undergo an operation on Friday and miss the matches against Italy and Scotland at Twickenham and Salisbury Plain, respectively.
Robinson picked up the injury in a match against Ireland at Lansdowne Road on Saturday and is now out of contention for the captaincy role.
In addition to missing key players like Jonny Wilkinson, Mike Tiendall, Will Greenwood, Julian White, Phil Vickey, and Matt Dawson, England is short on candidates for their captaincy role.
The announcement is a setback for Robinson's injury-deprived squad, which also includes former skipper Jeremy Guscott who has picked his preferred candidate as Matt Dawson.
As the tournament progresses, it remains to be seen whether or not England will make an announcement regarding their captaincy options.
tinydolphin:1.1b: [In summary,] England announced that Jason Robinson, the captain of their rugby team, will miss the remainder of the Six Nations due to injury, effectively replacing Jonny Wilkinson as England's skipper.
This follows a recent series of injuries and misfortunes for England's rugby team, leaving coach Andy Robinson with several key players absent.
phi:2.7b: Jason Robinson, the England captain and Sale Sharks full-back, has been injured with a torn ligament in his right thumb.
He is set to undergo surgery on Friday but won't be able to play in England's final two Six Nations games at Twickenham or any club games.
The coach of England, Andy Robinson, expressed disappointment for Jason and hopes he will return early in April.
The team has yet to name a replacement skipper, but former England captain Jeremy Guscott believes Matt Dawson would make an excellent choice due to his experience.
Other key players have also been injured, leaving the question of who will lead England's squad without a regular starting player.
orca-mini:3b: Robinson, the England captain, will miss the rest of the Six Nations because of injury.
He had been due to lead England in their final two games against Italy and Scotland but pulled out of the squad on Wednesday due to a torn ligament in his right thumb.
The Sale full-back underwent an operation on Friday but England have yet to name a replacement skipper.
Robinson was disappointed for himself but also for the team as they lost several key figures already missing due to injury.
Among them are Jonny Wilkinson, Mike Tindall, Will Greenwood, Julian White and Phil Vickery.
The only captaincy options left are those of Jeremy Guscott who suggests Matt Dawson as the obvious choice despite his record at captain.
hermes3:3b: Jason Robinson (Eng captain) injured, will miss rest of Six Nations and 2 games for club Sale Sharks due to torn ligament in thumb.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: England captain Jason Robinson will miss the remainder of the Six Nations due to injury, with a torn ligament in his right thumb.
The 30-year-old full-back is set to undergo surgery and will be replaced as captain during England's final two games against Italy and Scotland.
Coach Andy Robinson expressed disappointment for Robinson but looked forward to his return in April.
Meanwhile, former England skipper Jeremy Guscott suggested Matt Dawson as a potential replacement candidate for the vacant captaincy role.

Robinson, who was standing in for Jonny Wilkinson, had been set to lead England against Italy and Scotland but will now be sidelined until early April.
His absence adds to England's injury woes, with key players like Wilkinson, Mike Tindall, and Will Greenwood already out.
Coach Andy Robinson expressed disappointment, praising Robinson's leadership.
Former England captain Jeremy Guscott suggested Matt Dawson as a potential replacement, despite his inconsistent starting role.
England will announce their squad for the Italy match on Saturday.

Robinson underwent an operation, but a replacement skipper has not been named yet.
He previously picked up an injury during the defeat to Ireland, causing disappointment for him as well as the team.
A list of other players already absent includes Jonny Wilkinson, Mike Tindall, Will Greenwood, Julian White and Phil Vickery.
Coach Andy Robinson hopes Robinson makes a full recovery soon with possible candidates for captaincy being Matt Dawson or Martin Corry.
England is set to announce their squad for the match against Italy on Saturday.
granite3.1-dense:2b: England captain Jason Robinson will be absent from the remainder of the Six Nations due to a torn ligament in his right thumb, sustained during the Ireland match.
He underwent surgery on Friday and is expected to recover by early April.
The 30-year-old full-back was set to lead England in their final two games against Italy and Scotland at Twickenham.
This injury further depletes England's already injured squad, which includes Jonny Wilkinson, Mike Tindall, Will Greenwood, Julian White, Phil Vickery, and others.
Coach Andy Robinson expressed disappointment over Robinson's absence, highlighting his leadership during autumn internationals and the Six Nations.

The team will announce a replacement captain soon, with former England skipper Jeremy Guscott suggesting Matt Dawson as a potential choice due to his experience despite an average winning record as captain.
